intro: Hippocratea cassinoides, commonly known as the Cassin's hippocratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Bolivia and Peru. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
